greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows in which row n (n>=0) is a list of the numbers of different regions into which n lines can divide the plane.
link: O. A. Ivanov, On the number of regions into which n straight lines divide the plane, Amer. Math. Monthly, 117 (2010), 881-888.
xref: A000124, A055503, and A263883 are subsequences.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 18 2010
ext: Duplicate term 22 removed on row n=6 and example fixed by _Luc Rousseau_, Feb 25 2019
